text:
October is LGBTQI+ History Month.

As a member of the @EqualityCaucus, I am proud to commit to supporting all American families, protecting equality under law, and ensuring that our LGBTQI+ communities are celebrated.

Happy LGBTQI+ History Month!üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà

Today we celebrate #WorldTeachersDay!

Please join me in celebrating our educators that nurture the next generation of leaders and equip them with the tools they need to achieve their dreams.

How will you thank a teacher today? üìö

Early detection is one of our most important tools. Please continue to talk with your health care team and get regular screenings.

For more information and support resources, please visit womenshealth.gov/cancer/brea‚Ä¶.

October is #BreastCancerAwarenessMonth.

As a two-time survivor, I remember how scary it was to first learn of my diagnosis. Join me in honoring survivors, researchers, doctors, caregivers, those fighting, and those we've lost.

You are in my heart. ü©∑

Congratulations to our newest colleague in Congress & member of the @TheBlackCaucus, U.S. Senator Laphonza Butler!

For the children across the country who look like us, this is an historic moment for those who can now see themselves in your work & be inspired by your efforts.
Lower health care costs are now a reality for thousands of Americans. The Inflation Reduction Act we passed is saving 116,000 people in #GA07 an average of $570 each year.

Please join me in wishing President Jimmy Carter a Happy 99th Birthday today.

The nation and our state thank you for your continuous commitment to the American people. I hope your day is full of love, joy, and laughter!

Senator Feinstein truly shaped the modern gun violence prevention movement. As a survivor and advocate myself, I am deeply grateful for her work to save innocent lives. 

I send my condolences to her staff and family. May her memory be a blessing.

As a U.S. Senator, she was a champion for gun violence prevention as the author of the 1994 Assault Weapons Ban. Since its expiration in 2004, she remained a constant advocate for its reauthorization.

Dianne Feinstein was a trailblazer who paved the way for women at the highest levels of government. 

Her life and political career were deeply impacted by gun violence. She became mayor of San Francisco after the assassination of Mayor George Moscone and Supervisor Harvey Milk.

Happy Mid-Autumn Festival!

Gather your friends and family this week to enjoy the occasion. Wishing all success and happiness.

Of all the titles I've held in my life, "Mom" is the most important. On #NationalSonsDay, I celebrate the life of my Jordan.

When he was taken from me by senseless gun violence, I knew that it could not be the end of his story. I work to continue his legacy.

The Inflation Reduction Act we passed last year is bringing billions in investments to our communities.

This is helping safely reconnect families by providing more than $9,200,000,000 to fix the 374 bridges and over 2,260 miles of highway in poor condition in Georgia.

Groups in Georgia are receiving more than $17 million in grants to help families access green space and keep cool during extreme heat from @POTUS's plan, @BuildingBack_US.

Learn more‚¨áÔ∏è
usda.gov/media/press-release‚Ä¶

I was proud to support the Inflation Reduction Act and help ensure our seniors can get the medication they need.

Thanks to the $35 monthly cap on insulin that I led, 2,700 Medicare beneficiaries in #GA07 are saving more than $450 a year on their insulin.

BIG NEWS: @USsoccer is putting down roots in Georgia. We know our national teams are very goal-oriented, so what a way to "kick" off this new chapter!

Welcome to the Metro Atlanta family!

A time for reflection and introspection, Yom Kippur is one of the holiest days of the Jewish New Year.

To those who continue to observe the fast, G‚Äômar Chatimah Tovah.
Jordan‚Äôs spirit has helped turn my pain into purpose to end gun violence, keep our families safe, and make life better for the communities we all love.

This is about the lives of our loved ones. Every time I tell Jordan‚Äôs story, I feel the pain of losing my son. 

But the grief I still feel means his legacy still lives. It means Jordan still matters.

And it is the last sacrifice a mom like me can make for her only son.

I dedicated my entire life to raising my son, Jordan. 10 years ago, a man drove up next to him at a gas station, fired ten rounds into the car, killing my only son. @POTUS knows the deep pain of losing a loved one, and today marks a new era in the fight to keep us all safe.

Ten years ago, my son Jordan was murdered by a man who pulled up next to them and complained about the ‚Äòloud music‚Äô they were playing. 

I applaud today‚Äôs announcement, and look forward to the continued leadership of the @WhiteHouse on this issue of life and death.

John Lewis called the right to vote precious, almost sacred.

Today, my colleagues and I are reintroducing the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act, named for our late friend. We cannot allow anyone to undermine his legacy. We must restore and modernize the Voting Rights Act.

Rosh Hashanah is a time of celebration for Jewish communities across Georgia and the world.

As the holiday begins, I wish all a happy and sweet New Year filled with food and loved ones. Shanah tovah!

Ethan Song was 15 when he was killed by an unsecured gun.

A gun in an unsupervised child‚Äôs hands is a deadly risk. No parent should lose their child this way.

Today, a discharge petition was introduced on Ethan‚Äôs Law to set federal standards for safe gun storage. #KeepKidsSafe

On the 22nd anniversary of the September 11th attacks, our nation remembers those lost, honors their families, and thanks the first responders who worked to save countless lives.

We know that many wounds remain unseen and painful‚Äîwe must never forget.

As we recognize #InternationalLiteracyDay, we highlight the need for access to quality education across our globe. 

We must take to heart our task of setting future generations up for success.

Guns are the #1 killer of kids in America. My son, Jordan, was murdered by gun violence.

We don't have to accept this as the new normal.

I‚Äôm working in Congress to expand background checks, empower loved ones, and protect our kids. #EndGunViolence

Happy Labor Day! Today, we celebrate the hard-working spirit of Americans and their families.

You all are why our nation continues to march forward, and I wish you a safe time with friends and loved ones.

78 years ago today, World War II officially ended. It is still the deadliest conflict in our history.

The courage and sacrifices of those who served must never be forgotten. We are eternally grateful to our veterans and their families.

Learn more about these prescription drugs and what this announcement means for your family‚¨áÔ∏è
washingtonpost.com/health/20‚Ä¶
NEW: Thanks to the Inflation Reduction Act we passed last year, Medicare is now able to negotiate for lower drug costs for 10 common drugs, saving Americans thousands.

Today marks 60 years since the March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom, when thousands gathered on our National Mall in support of civil rights.

I was there, pushed along by my mother and father in the stroller.

May we all continue fighting for what is right and what is just.

Happy #NationalDogDay to my Harley and all our furry friends. Our pets fill our lives with joy.

I'm proud to lead the BARK Act and ensure animals in shelters are well-fed as they wait for their forever homes.

As we celebrate #WomensEqualityDay, we must never forget how far we have come and how far we have yet to go.

I am blessed to know so many wonderful hearts in my life and through this work. May we together secure bright, safe, and healthy futures for all.

The overturning of #RoevWade left millions of Americans without access to reproductive care.

Women‚Äôs rights are human rights and reproductive care IS health care.

Medical decisions should be made by women and those they trust, not politicians and officials. #ReproductiveFreedom

Two years ago today, we passed the John R. Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act through the House.

As a daughter of the Civil Rights Movement, I am proud to continue our fight for equality and access to the ballot box.

All voices must be heard.

Our event is starting soon!

Join us by calling (877) 299-5762 at the time of the event or streaming at mcbath.house.gov/live.

I'm hosting a Telephone Town Hall tonight at 6:00pm with experts from @HHSGov, @CMSGov, @FTC, and @AARP to discuss ways to keep our communities healthy and safe.

You can join us by calling (877) 299-5762 at the time of the event or by going to mcbath.house.gov/live.

Wonderful to join the @ProtectOurCare Bus Tour in Duluth today!

Life-saving medicine should never be kept out of reach of those who need it most. The Inflation Reduction Act is driving down health care costs and paving the way for our communities to live full and healthy lives.
I'm proud to cosponsor Violet's Law to make lab animal adoption an option and give a second chance to more dogs, cats, and other animals. @WhiteCoatWaste

Today we're celebrating the anniversary of the #InflationReductionAct, which I was proud to vote to pass!

Growing our Georgia economy with new clean energy jobs and $18 BILLION in new private sector investments is definitely worth celebrating.

üíä Lower prescription drug costs
üè• Lower health care costs
‚ö° Lower energy costs

One year ago, my colleagues and I delivered the #InflationReductionAct to lower costs for American families‚Äîincluding a $35 insulin cap that I championed. We're working to continue that progress.

When President Roosevelt signed the Social Security Act into law in 1935, it was with the belief that it would help Americans both young and old. It has served as a vital resource for 88 years.

If you have questions about your benefits, visit my website.
mcbath.house.gov/help
As we mark 78 years since V-J Day and the end of World War II, let us take a moment to remember the more than 16 million Americans who served. Today and always, we thank and honor our veterans.

As the school year gets underway, I encourage students to enter my Congressional App Challenge! Open to all middle & high school students in GA-07, this competition is perfect for anyone interested in coding or computer science.

Visit my website for more! mcbath.house.gov/congression‚Ä¶
It was a pleasure to visit @SiemensUSA here in Georgia and see their EV infrastructure contributions in action. Thanks for having me!

One year ago today, @POTUS signed the #CHIPSandScienceAct into law. This historic level of investment harnessed our nation's power, and its promises continue to deliver.

üíµGood-paying jobs
üìâEasing Inflation
üî¨Investments in Research & Innovation

Tomorrow, Aug. 9, is the deadline to submit an intent to file form so that any additional benefits you may be entitled to are retroactively applied to the date the PACT Act became law.

Visit the link to get started and call my office with any questions!
va.gov/resources/your-intent‚Ä¶

Students in Gwinnett are ready for an amazing school year! With the help of WeLoveU volunteers, we were able to hand out over 900 new bookbags to students at Meadowcreek Elementary School on their first day.

I'm wishing everyone a blessed, safe, and successful school year!

Today, @SenOssoff and I celebrated the Chattahoochee River Act in Peachtree Corners! This bipartisan law invests in water-related resource protection and restoration projects along the Chattahoochee and will help protect this vital natural resource for generations to come.

School counselors set our students up for emotional and academic success.

Thank you @SecCardona for coming to Georgia to hear from our counselors and share the work we are doing to help students. As our kids head back to school this week, I send my best wishes for a great year!

Since their creation 58 years ago, Medicare and Medicaid have helped millions of Americans get the health care they need.

If you need assistance solving an issue related to these programs, please call my office at (470) 773-6330 or visit my website.
mcbath.house.gov/help

Seventy years ago, @SBAgov was founded to help entrepreneurs start small businesses and ensure they thrive.

It was an honor to host @SBAIsabel in Georgia earlier this year. Small businesses are the backbone of our economy and an invaluable part of our community.

On this day 65 years ago, President Eisenhower signed the National Aeronautics and Space Act of 1958.

I would like to celebrate @NASA for their cutting-edge research while continuing to expand our knowledge with STEM education.
Harley and I think the BARK Act is paw-some! üêæ

Transit users in Georgia‚Äôs most diverse and fastest-growing county deserve a modern facility, especially on hot summer days.

They'll soon have one, thanks to the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law and the RAISE grant I fought for alongside @SenOssoff.
ajc.com/news/ossoff-mcbath-v‚Ä¶

It was a pleasure to join @SenOssoff and @GwinnettGov yesterday to celebrate the $20 million RAISE grant that will completely modernize the Gwinnett Place Transit Center in #GA07.

A historic investment from the historic Bipartisan Infrastructure Law. üöå

Today, @SenOssoff and I celebrated a $20 million RAISE grant award which will transform the future of transit in our community.

Historic investments like this are why we supported the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law. Congratulations to @GwinnettGov!
mcbath.house.gov/press-relea‚Ä¶

Self care is necessary, important, and looks different for everyone. One of my favorite practices is prayer.

On this International Self Care Day, take time to connect with loved ones, go outside, rest, or exercise. For additional resources, visit isfglobal.org/

It's been 11 years since 12 people were killed while attending the movies in Aurora, CO.

No one should ever have to worry about losing a loved one in a shopping mall, at a gas station, or at the movie theater.

Families should not have to live in fear. Americans deserve better.

As a pet owner and animal lover, I understand how important pets are to our families.

I'm proud to join my colleagues to introduce the bipartisan #BARKAct to help direct surplus pet food to shelters and nurture America‚Äôs animals as they await adoption to their forever homes.

It was a pleasure welcoming @SecCardona to Georgia for a roundtable today!

We are truly blessed in #GA07 to have wonderful school counselors who recognize how essential it is that our students have every tool necessary to succeed academically.

As Americans gathered nationwide with friends and family to observe the founding of our democracy, celebrations were met with further acts of senseless gun violence.

Gun violence must be stopped, and Congress must act once again to save lives. #EndGunViolence

With the signing of my bill last year, insulin is now $35 a month for our seniors on Medicare Part B.

The costs of this medicine have been far too high for far too long. This should be the new standard in America.

There is no freedom when we live in fear that celebrations will transform into tragedy.

Friends and families deserve to spend time with loved ones and neighbors in peace. It‚Äôs our duty as elected lawmakers to protect our fellow Americans.
cbsnews.com/news/july-4-mass‚Ä¶

Malon James, a 12-year-old constituent of #GA07, is using hydroponic farming to help those who struggle with food insecurity.

He has worked with the @UniversityofGA and donates crops to his local food pantry. May he be an inspiration to us all!
11alive.com/article/news/com‚Ä¶

It's important that Georgia‚Äôs families are prepared when severe weather strikes.

I‚Äôm proud to partner with the @WeatherChannel to encourage all to create an emergency plan, practice that plan, and remain vigilant to developing weather conditions.

Airing on your local station!üì∫

America is a nation of immigrants, from every corner of this globe.

It was an honor to speak at one of our local ceremonies and mark the end of a long journey to citizenship for many neighbors. Congratulations to all!
wsbtv.com/news/50-new-us-cit‚Ä¶
I wish you and your families a safe and festive Fourth of July!

Today, we solemnly remember the 7 lives lost last year in Highland Park.

Senseless gun violence doesn't discriminate. Whether learning in school, praying at a house of worship, or celebrating July 4th, we are all at risk.

We must #EndGunViolence.

The 1964 Civil Rights Act was one of the most pivotal points in the fight for civil rights in our nation.

When President Johnson signed it into law, my father was standing with him.

As we continue our fight for equity, may we honor the legacies of those who have come before us.

In July of 1965, the original form of Medicare was signed into law and set up an avenue for older Americans to have affordable, quality health care coverage.

Are you or someone you know newly eligible? Sign up or learn more at Medicare.gov.

Today, my bill to cut insulin costs to $35 a month goes into effect for Americans on Medicare Part B. This law lowers health care costs across the country, and makes a drug that many diabetics need every day more affordable for the seniors who need it.

piped.video/watch?v=G_RuKdL1‚Ä¶

It's been one year since Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson was sworn in as the first Black woman to serve on the Supreme Court.

I hope that our youth witness this history and realize that anyone, regardless of gender or race, may grow up to be whatever they set their mind to.

As we reach the end of Pride Month, celebrations are still going strong. Yesterday, my office attended a Gwinnett Pride event and presented Chairwoman Hendrickson and the Gwinnett County Commission with a Congressional Record statement from my office to commemorate the occasion!
Eid al-Adha Mubarak to all of our friends who celebrate! I‚Äôm wishing you all a blessed evening with family and friends.

üö®Funding Alertüö®

I'm thrilled to announce that Gwinnett County will receive $20M to replace the Gwinnett Place Transit Center.

This money will be transformative in shaping the future of transit in Gwinnett. I was so proud to support this application!
ajc.com/news/gwinnett-snags-‚Ä¶

On #NationalHIVTestingDay, I encourage everyone to know their status and get tested.

HIV tests are easy, quick, and often free! Getting tested for HIV is an important part of ending this epidemic and taking action to protect your health.

Today, highspeed broadband is a necessity for all Georgians.

This $1.3B in funding will help lift barriers to employment, education, family, and friends for those who need it most!

Eight years ago, the Supreme Court affirmed in Obergefell v. Hodges the right for same-sex couples to marry.

In the face of recent assaults on marriage equality, I am proud to celebrate and support the right of all Americans to marry the person they love.

üö® NEWS: Georgia will receive $1.3 billion for broadband internet expansion!

Families rely on access to broadband for their jobs, their schoolwork, and keeping in touch with loved ones. I‚Äôm thrilled to see these federal funds come home to our state!

One year ago, the Bipartisan Safer Communities Act was signed into law to fight senseless gun violence.

I'm proud to have fought for the first major gun reform bill in a generation. We continue the fight for safer neighborhoods & communities, every day.
bostonglobe.com/2022/06/24/n‚Ä¶

A year ago, the Dobbs decision overturned Roe v. Wade and allowed states to begin attacking the reproductive care that so many women rely on.

I am one of those women. For two weeks, I carried my dead fetus.

This is my story.

There's one week left to RSVP for my PACT Act Briefing with Gwinnett County Commissioner Jasper Watkins. Don't miss the opportunity to learn more about this historic expansion of veteran benefits.

RSVP at PACTActGA07.eventbrite.com. I look forward to seeing you on July 6th!

Ten years ago, the Shelby County ruling opened the floodgates to voting discrimination with an intensity that has only continued.

Voting rights protect all other rights, and today we fight on to protect and exercise the fundamental right to vote. #ShelbyAt10

Gun-related incidents are the leading cause of death for children in the U.S.

On National #ASKday, we remind parents to ask if there are unlocked firearms before their child visits another home. A simple ask can save a life.

I would like to wish every one of our neighbors in the Seventh District a happy first day of Summer! I hope it can bring a season of relaxation, growth, and joy to you all.

Summer in Georgia is a beautiful thing ‚òÄÔ∏èüçë

Thoughts and prayers are not stopping the carnage of gun violence. If that is all you have to offer, I say this:

Faith without works is dead. Prayers without action are hollow. It is common-sense solutions that will save lives. It is these policies that will fulfill our promise.

Juneteenth commemorates the true end of slavery in this country, more than 2 years after the Emancipation Proclamation was signed.

As we celebrate freedom today, may we also solemnly remember the long-fought battle to fully realize it.
Happy Father's Day to all the Dads and father figures in #GA07 and across our nation!

After the conviction of my son‚Äôs killer, I made a promise.

I would take all the love I had as a mother and spend the rest of my life devoted to making sure parents across the country never had to go through the same pain that I did.

I came to Congress to fulfill that promise.

Eight years ago today, Mother Emanuel AME Church in Charleston was devastated by an act of graphic and senseless violence.

We must never forget the names and faces of those we lost. We owe it to their families to end gun violence and the hate that fuels it.

This week marks a new step in our journey to ending gun violence in America.

My colleagues and I filed discharge petitions to force Republican leadership to bring common-sense gun safety legislation to the floor.

I'm excited to launch the #GA07 2023 Congressional App Challenge! If you are a middle or high schooler interested in coding, I encourage you to participate in this competition!

To learn more, visit my website at mcbath.house.gov/congression‚Ä¶. I can't wait to see what you create!

When Americans purchase tickets, they should never have to guess the price they're going to pay.

Transparency will lower costs for working Americans, getting rid of the junk fees that are frustrating for those just looking to have a good time with their friends and families.

I had the chance to assemble care packages with @The_USO as we help support Americans serving overseas.

We are grateful for all the USO does to support our service men and women. Thanks for bringing your support to Washington!

The PACT Act was a historic expansion of benefits for veterans and their families who were impacted by toxic exposure.

On July 6 at 12 pm, I'm teaming up with Gwinnett County Commissioner @J_WatkinsD3 to present a PACT Act briefing‚Äîplease join us!
PACTActGA07.eventbrite.com
Happy 248th birthday @USArmy!

We've experienced more mass shootings this year than there have been days. Gun violence is the challenge of our lifetime and the issue of our era.

We have filed today‚Äôs discharge petition because we have been sent to Congress to use every tool to help save American lives.

Today marks a new step in our journey to ending gun violence in America.üß°

My colleagues and I have just filed discharge petitions to force Republican leadership to bring common-sense gun safety legislation to the floor.

Today, we commemorate the tragic anniversary of the Pulse nightclub shooting. These victims were targeted for living as their true selves.

We stand with survivors and continue our work to keep weapons of war out of the hands of those who wish harm. #PulseDayOfRemembrance

60 years ago today, the Equal Pay Act became law to protect against wage discrimination in the workplace.

60 years later, the gender pay gap still exists, especially for people of color.

Every American should earn equal pay for equal work, regardless of their gender.

Weapons of war do not belong on our streets, in our classrooms, or in our communities.

I'm proud to lead the Assault Weapons Ban in the House. We must do everything we can to keep families safe. America deserves that. üß°

#SurvivorSitIn @NewtownAction @LivesRobbed @ChangeTheRef

Today marks the 79th anniversary of D-Day. As tens of thousands serving the United States and our allies risked their lives to defend freedom and democracy, thousands more paid the ultimate price to do so.

May we pause and recognize their sacrifice.
Faith without works is dead. We must all summon the courage to act and #EndGunViolence.

For the first time in a decade, I didn't cry on Mother‚Äôs Day this year.

I know the grief feels immense. We carry on the legacy of our loved ones in our hearts and our spirits as we turn pain into progress.

Together, we will win this fight to save lives.

Parents in Uvalde have been learning to live without their children for a year now. Families in Buffalo have survived 365 days without their loved ones.

After my son was murdered by a man with hate in his heart, I cried out to God in my grief. Why did this happen to my child?

Today, I #WearOrange for my son, Jordan.üß°

I #WearOrange because there have already been more shootings than days this year.

I #WearOrange on behalf of those who can no longer speak for themselves.

We all must find the courage to act to end gun violence.

Happy Pride! Remember that no matter who you are, or who you love, you are perfect just the way you are.

As we continue to see attacks on the rights of the LGBTQI+ community, we must stand together and fight for equality for all. @EqualityCaucus

While he many not be here to celebrate with me today, I know he'll be wishing me a happy birthday as he watches over me.

Birthdays should continue to be a day of celebration, not of mourning. I hope you will join me in our fight to keep our communities safe. üß°

Today is my birthday! But more important, it is the start of #GunViolenceAwarenessMonth.

Since Jordan was murdered, it has been hard to forget his empty seat at celebrations.

On #MemorialDay, we remember the lives of Americans, of all creeds and colors, who died protecting our nation and our ideals.

We honor their ultimate sacrifice.

I struggled to start a family. After I finally did, I learned that I had breast cancer‚Äîtwice.

Our health care journeys are unique. What we should agree on, however, is that every woman deserves access to the care that they so deeply need. #InternationalDayofActionForWomensHealth

The frequency of senseless gun violence should never stop us from pausing to grieve alongside survivors.

Today, my heart is with the families of Robb Elementary School.

From one grieving family to another, I pray that you always find joy in the memories of your loved ones.

There is no reason that any child in this country should face the pain of hunger or the uncertainty of their next meal.

I know that families across this country rely on the resources, education, and support that WIC provides.

Read more in @TheHill‚§µÔ∏è
thehill.com/opinion/congress‚Ä¶

Today is the 30th Anniversary of the "Motor Voter" National Voter Registration Act, a historic expansion of voter access and an important step in protecting the right to vote. Our work to defend the right to vote continues, every day.

Are you registered to vote? üó≥Ô∏è
I am joining @SenatorWarnock @ChrisMurphyCT and @RepMaxwellFrost to stand with survivors and advocates as we work to end this epidemic of unnecessary gun violence.

Over the past 58 years, Head Start has grown to a comprehensive program stretching all 50 states & territories, helping transform the lives of more than 37 million children & their families nationwide.

Join us in celebrating Head Start's birthday! #HappyBirthdayHeadStartüíñüíô5Ô∏è‚É£8Ô∏è‚É£

All people deserve the same protections and fundamental rights, regardless of who they are or who they love.

As a member of the @EqualityCaucus, I'm committed to protecting and uplifting the LGBTQI+ community.

69 years ago, the #BrownvBoard decision marked a monumental step toward equality in education.

We must keep fighting until all children in our nation have equal opportunities in education.

Rabiatou's piece, Delirium, will be displayed in my Duluth district office.

Congratulations once again to our winners!
Ranier's piece, GHOST, will be displayed in my Washington office.
Madeline's piece, Retreat, will be displayed in the Cannon Tunnel at the US Capitol.

I'm so pleased to announce the winners of my 2023 Congressional Art Competition!

Congratulations to Madeline Soh, Ranier Diaz, Rabiatou Ndiaye, and to all participants from this year's competition! It is a privilege to showcase our district's incredible talent.

I am proud to uplift and celebrate our AANHPI communities right here in #GA07.

Last night, my office attended @GwinnettGov's AANHPI celebration and presented the county with a Congressional Record statement I introduced in honor of the occasion. Happy #AANHPIHeritageMonth!

Our nation has the highest maternal mortality rate of any high-income country. There has never been comprehensive federal action to solve our maternal crisis ‚Äî until the #Momnibus. I‚Äôve introduced the #Momnibus with @RepUnderwood, @RepAdams, and @SenBooker to save our moms.

I‚Äôm a two-time breast cancer survivor and struggled to start a family. Our health is about more than our own lives‚Äîit impacts our families and loved ones, too.

As women, it's vital that we lift up one another to empower ourselves and protect the health of all. #WomensHealthWeek

I want to wish a Happy Mother‚Äôs Day to all mothers out there. Thank you for all that you do to love and support our families.

Becoming a mom was one of the greatest joys of my life, and there's not a day that goes by that my heart does not ache for my son, Jordan.‚ù§Ô∏è

Today I want to thank and celebrate all of the spouses and families of our service members on #MilitarySpouseAppreciationDay.

You are an integral part of the success and strength of our forces. Thank you for the sacrifices you make.

Harley and I want to wish all pets and their families across Georgia a Happy #NationalPetWeek!

Thanks to the @AJC for the shout out!

Like so many women in America, I struggled to get pregnant. My son, Jordan, was a blessing for my family. 

Mothers and infants across this country rely on the support #WIC provides, and our bill improves the quality of formula contracts available.
mcbath.house.gov/press-relea‚Ä¶

During #NationalNursesWeek, I want to express my deep gratitude for our nation‚Äôs nurses.

My mother was a nurse, and I was always in awe of her level of care. Your care and heroic sacrifices are noticed and appreciated. Thank you for all that you do!

Assault weapons were designed for war zones, not for our communities.

We must #BanAssaultWeapons now. @bradybuzz

In a mall, in a grocery store, in a nightclub, in a school, in a place of worship...the list goes on.

We don‚Äôt have to live this way. Let‚Äôs find
common-ground in common-sense solutions.
#BanAssaultWeapons @bradybuzz

Our combat veterans and our nation‚Äôs children should not be able to swap war stories. Yet, both have the risk of being gunned down with assault weapons anywhere in America.

We must #StopTheAssault and #BanAssaultWeapons. @bradybuzz
We don't have to live like this. We don't have to live in our communities with our families always in fear. We can #EndGunViolence.

How much more blood and carnage do my colleagues in Washington and in state legislatures have to see? What more does it take?

People in this country are screaming for gun safety regulation that saves lives. Thoughts and prayers are NOT enough. The American public are tired.

62 years ago, the late John Lewis and 12 other Freedom Riders continued their fight against segregation on the first Freedom Ride.

Their determination inspired change and further desegregation of our country. May we honor their bravery.

On this #NationalDayOfPrayer, I am sending love and prayers to all.
